A: 1. A baker made 8 cakes. He divided them into 2 equal parts. How many cakes are in each part? (a) 3 (b) 4 (c) 5
2. There are 4 children. Each child has 5 fingers on one hand. How many fingers are there in all on one hand for all children? (a) 10 (b) 15 (c) 20
3. A farmer has 12 apples. He wants to divide them into 4 equal groups. How many apples are in each group? (a) 3 (b) 4 (c) 6
4. A box holds 5 pencils. If you have 3 such boxes, how many pencils do you have in total? (a) 8 (b) 10 (c) 15
5. A teacher has 7 groups of students. Each group has 5 books. How many books are there in total? (a) 30 (b) 35 (c) 40
6. A jug can hold 10 cups of water. If you pour out 3 cups, how many cups are left? (a) 5 (b) 7 (c) 8
7. There are 5 birds on a tree. Each bird has 2 wings. How many wings are there in total? (a) 7 (b) 10 (c) 12
8. What is half of 6 bananas? (a) 2 (b) 3 (c) 4
9. Half of 10 oranges is _ (a) 4 (b) 5 (c) 6
10. One quarter of 8 bananas is _ bananas (a) 2 (b) 4 (c) 8
11. One quarter of 12 oranges is _ oranges (a) 3 (b) 4 (c) 6
12. In the fraction ½, the number 2 is called the _ (a) numerator (b) denominator (c) whole
13. In the fraction ⅛, the number 1 is called the _ (a) numerator (b) denominator (c) part
14. The fraction ⅓ means 1 out of _ equal parts (a) 2 (b) 3 (c) 4
15. Which fraction shows one out of five parts? (a) ⅕ (b) ¼ (c) ⅓
16. The fraction ¾ means _ out of 4 equal parts (a) 1 (b) 2 (c) 3
18. How many hours are in a day? (a) 12 (b) 24 (c) 60
19. When the big hand on a clock points to 12, it means it is _ o'clock (a) half past (b) quarter past (c) exactly
20. How many seconds are in one minute? (a) 30 (b) 60 (c) 100
B: 1. Two equal parts of a whole are called _________
2. Four equal parts of a whole are called _________
3. The bottom number in a fraction is called the _________
4. The top number in a fraction is called the _________
5. How many minutes are in a half hour?
C: 4. What is the amount a container holds called?
5. What is the total amount a container can hold called?
